programme.sub-title: Home Sweet Homestead: Where the Heart is
programme.desc: The Raneys pass on essential skills to the next generation. Later, they check in via video with homesteaders who built a house with 30,000 rubber tyres

programme.title: Fish or Die
programme.desc: The intrepid anglers are in Borneo searching for the mahseer - a fish close to extinction. To find it, they risk entering the territory of the headhunting Dayak people

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: WWE star Chris Jericho asks Brett Raymer and Wayde King to build him a large aquarium, complete with a replica championship belt, and a list of Jericho

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Houston SPCAs Chief Investigator Charles Jantzen joins his team on an emergency mission in Galveston to try to save hundreds of trapped pets from Hurricane Ike

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Steve Irwin loved sea turtles. Terri and Robert continue his legacy as they transport three rescued sea turtles to Lady Elliot Island on the Great Barrier Reef - for the first time, by air. This complex mission is vital in order to help conserve these beautiful but endangered animals. While Robert and Terri take to the skies, Bindi and the team are nervously waiting for the birth of Australia Zoos first Sumatran tiger cub in three years. Richie from the rescue unit helps with a baby wallabys struggle for survival

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia attempts to rescue a stray, but her leg injury holds her back, and new parolee Mike struggles to balance working and parenthood

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.sub-title: Home Sweet Homestead: Rugged Road Home
programme.desc: Marty embarks on a dangerous self-shot mission to carve a road up 300-ft cliffs. Meanwhile, Misty enlists her family to build a predator-proof coop for the chickens

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.sub-title: Home Sweet Homestead: Future of the Forty
programme.desc: Spring arrives and the family self-shoots preparation for the epic expansion of their homestead. Misty plots a huge greenhouse to feed three generations

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The Game Wardens have a busy weekend in Texas as they deal with thousands of festival-goers on the San Marcos River and a patrol on Lake Texoma leads to multiple arrests

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.sub-title: The Dog Who Won Jeffs Heart
programme.desc: A client brings in an unusual pet who is fast outgrowing his enclosure. Dr Jeff treats a cat with several serious - and mysterious - injuries

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson designs a beehive-style structure for couple Donald and Alison Farmer. The small space includes shelving, soft seating and hexagonal, honeycomb-inspired features

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: Following residents in the Frank Church Wilderness in Idaho. As the winter ice thaws, people living on the bank are forced to navigate the spring rapids

programme.desc: In Alaska, Marty rescues his property from a deluge of snow runoff. Meanwhile in Hawaii, Matt builds a human-sized slingshot to bring down invasive trees

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri returns to her hometown of Oregon to help Brady, a cougar in need of a health check. At the zoo, Bindi bathes an echidna with bad skin allergies

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Game Wardens patrol the Rio Grande seeking an unidentified body, whilst Warden Powell explores an unusual deer case. And, a nuisance alligator is relocated

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff operates on a rottweiler with a broken shoulder and Dr Baier sees to a limping pig. The team heads to the mountains to treat some wolves

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff conducts tricky surgery to remove a large mass from a Dobermans side. Dr Baier treats a 10-year-old cockatiel which is having trouble breathing

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia is in Detroit helping a rescue facility at risk of closure. Villalobos looks for a stray pit bull nearby and a grieving adopter wants a dog to heal her heart

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tania and Earl set off to rescue an adopted dog that has mysteriously turned up in a Mississippi shelter. Parolee Joe is shaken after separating two stray dogs fighting

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys reflect on some of their most challenging and ingenious builds, unpacking the daring techniques they used to build off-grid

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Amputee Jeff and wife Carol want a liveable home, water, and a place to grow food. Elsewhere, the Raneys build an entire cabin from scratch and harness a natural spring

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Two tastemakers hire Pete Nelson to create a cool treetop structure with a wall of windows and a crows nest

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: Dan travels to Chicago to give cockfighting roosters a second chance. The crew members worry whether an unruly cow will be welcomed by the rest of the herd

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: The process that caterpillars go through to transform into magnificent butterflies while in their cocoon. Plus, the facts about cats tongues

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Why some cats are cross-eyed, how meerkats are able to eat poisonous scorpions and hippos ability to sleep while holding their breath

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest Galante scours lakes and rivers of both metropolitan and rural Vietnam in search of one of the last living specimens of the giant softshell turtle

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A new bison calf struggles to keep up with its mother. Keepers at the Central Park Zoo hope the female snow monkeys accept a new male

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Brett and Wayde reveal information about the fish that customers and fans ask them about the most, before revealing some unseen moments from the series

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto, Eivin and August scramble to stake a claim on ten tons of steel on a distant beach. Meanwhile, Shane and Kelli break ground on their cabin

programme.title: Project Grizzly
programme.desc: Jeff Watson teaches his grizzlies to forage in the wild, but when Bob slashes him in the arm he is forced to reconsider the difficulty of them leaving the nest

programme.title: Project Grizzly
programme.desc: Jeff Watsons unconventional hunting lessons fail to prepare Bob and Screech to hunt game in the wild - but he discovers they may be learning on their own

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: A family survives in the Alaskan wilderness. As winter approaches, Billy faces a new medical crisis. Elsewhere, a storm forces Noah and Rhain Alisha to make a tough decision

programme.title: Extinct or Alive

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Catrin Heledd presents coverage of the evening session on day seven at York Barbican, featuring the opening two quarter-finals, played over the best of 11 frames, as the four players involved continued their bid to win the title claimed by Judd Trump last year. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Katy Hill presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 13 November 1998. Featuring Touch and Go, The Tamperer feat Maya, Tatyana Ali, Eagle-Eye Cherry, Faith Evans, East 17, Queen/Wyclef Jean and Pras Michel, and Cher

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Tony Blackburn and Noel Edmonds present a festive edition, originally broadcast in 1975. Among the performers are Pilot, Ralph McTell, Mud, 10cc, David Essex, Johnny Nash, Guys and Dolls, Thymes, Tammy Wynette, Bay City Rollers, Telly Savalas, Art Garfunkel, the Stylistics, and CCS. The programme also features a dance routine by Pans People

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Catrin Heledd presents concluding coverage of the evening session on day seven at York Barbican, featuring two quarter-finals, played over the best of 11 frames, as the line-up for the semi-finals is confirmed. Jack Lisowski took a 3-1 lead against Mark Allen at this stage last year, but the 2022 champion won five frames in a row to prevail 6-3. The sessions other last-eight contest saw 2024 world champion Kyren Wilson win by the same scoreline against Michael Holt. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: The 1984 Christmas Day edition, featuring Two Tribes by Frankie Goes to Hollywood, What Is Love? by Howard Jones, The Reflex by Duran Duran, I Wont Let the Sun Go Down on Me by Nik Kershaw, The War Song by Culture Club, Doctor Doctor by Thompson Twins, I Should Have Known Better by Jim Diamond, Wake Me Up Before You Go-Go by Wham!, Love of the Common People by Paul Young, Careless Whisper by George Michael and Do They Know its Christmas? by Band Aid

programme.title: The Making of Do They Know Its Christmas?
programme.desc: The story behind the 1984 UK number one song Do They Know Its Christmas?, written by Bob Geldof and Midge Ure and recorded by some of the biggest pop stars in the UK and Ireland at the time. The hit was released in aid of the 1983-1985 famine in Ethiopia and was the fastest selling single of all time for over a decade. This programme features unseen moments in which stars including Bananarama, Bono, Boy George, Duran Duran and George Michael rehearsed and recorded their parts, while interacting with each other during that 24 hours which would make musical history

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Tony Blackburn and Noel Edmonds present a festive edition, originally broadcast in 1975. programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the early stages of the second semi-final from York Barbican, where the first man to reach 11 frames will join this afternoons winner in the showpiece match. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: One of Siegfrieds old friends lends a hand during an emergency operation, James helps a client avoid arrest, and Helen plans a wedding anniversary dinner. Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham star

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried somehow manages to lose Mrs Pettingers cat and James tries to dissuade his daughter from becoming a vet. Rural drama, starring Robert Hardy and Christopher Timothy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried takes matters into his own hands when he discovers who shot war veteran Jacob Pearsons dog, and a farmer is found to be sneaking his cows onto a neighbouring property to enjoy better grazing. Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy star

programme.title: Mystery Road: Origin
programme.desc: In 1999, young police officer Jay Swan moves back to his home town of Jardine in the Outback to join its local force, but his homecoming is greeted by guns and friction with his father. Prequel to the Australian crime drama, starring Mark Coles Smith

programme.title: Mystery Road: Origin
programme.desc: After a bizarre robbery, Jay leads a visit to a local gang that quickly escalates. Anousha seeks clues about Josh Allens death, while Jays night takes a tragic turn after the towns celebrations at the annual debutante ball

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.sub-title: Judi Dench, Peter Kay, Will Young
programme.desc: The host is joined by star of stage and screen Judi Dench, comedian and actor Peter Kay and zoologist Charlotte Uhlenbroek. Singer-songwriter and actor Will Young provides the music. First broadcast 15 November 2003

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: One of Siegfrieds old friends lends a hand during an emergency operation, James helps a client avoid arrest, and Helen plans a wedding anniversary dinner. Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham star

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Greg Rutherford and Nikki Fox host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: The Hotel with No Running Water
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Louise Minchin, Gloria Hunniford and the team tackle travel problems, including the holidaymakers from Yorkshire who booked an all-inclusive package holiday to Ibiza but found the hotel had no running water. Plus, the airlines and handling agents misplacing and damaging wheelchairs and walking aids belonging to disabled customers, and the discount voucher website getting a ticking off for the way it promotes holiday deals

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: An amazing opportunity by the Kent coast has Martin Roberts spying a building opportunity. Dion Dublin has an issue staying upright in an uneven mid-terrace in Stoke-on-Trent, and is also in Hebden Bridge, West Yorkshire, to see a charming grade two-listed building

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian presents an episode focused on vintage board games. He visits a toy and model museum in Brighton and recalls the teams who gambled on such table-top treasures at auction. In Surrey, a magician and his son held faith on a 100-year-old olive wood card game counter, while in north Wales a duo hoped to put their opponents in check with a chess set carved from a tree trunk. Danny also learns about the ancient origins of snakes and ladders and plays a boisterous game of skill designed by injured First World War soldiers

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When a widow is assaulted, she gives the police a description of her attackers, though something about her account doesnt ring true. Frustrated by her suspension, Sasha takes out her angst on her ex, Donal. When Marlene tries to talk to Sasha about the kiss they shared, Sasha admits that shes in love with someone else. Clint is devastated when he discovers that his wife Nicole has gone behind his back, while Eve is convinced that somethings going on between her husband Luke and his ex-girlfriend. When Eve and Clint find themselves alone, they begin to see each other in a whole new light

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A new house in the Hampshire countryside is needed for a young couple and their two dogs, and Sonali Shah is on hand to show them the best properties the county has to offer for their £500,000 budget. While there, Sonali visits a contemporary and stylish family home and discovers why and how its energy bills are virtually non-existent

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Nepalese Rocking Horse, Fornasetti Coffee Table, Art Nouveau Glass Bowl
programme.desc: Nigel Havers meets five more sellers hoping to raises money with some interesting items. Mr Blobby superfan Colin brings in some TV history, Christie from Edinburgh arrives with a Nepalese rocking horse, while Lizs Dan Dare toy gun has the dealers in a spin

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Briony Harford wrap up their antiques hunt in Essex. Bee goes cute and cuddly, as she gathers together a quirky menagerie of collectibles. Raj sets his sights on a vintage bicycle, hoping it will let him ride to victory. Their journey includes a fascinating detour into the history of ink, where they learn about its origins and try their hand at crafting an eco-friendly alternative

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Farm 999
programme.sub-title: Fly-Tippers Get Caught in the Act
programme.desc: In Warwickshire, farmers take a stand against fly-tippers who have been blighting their land with van loads of dumped waste. In Northern Irelands Mourne Mountains, fast moving wildfires threaten grazing land and livestock, as exhausted firefighters and farmers join forces to bring the flames under control. In north Wales, reporter Paul Colgan meets Rhianon Bragg, a courageous survivor of domestic abuse whose terrifying ordeal on her rural smallholding exposed the hidden dangers faced by victims living in isolation

programme.title: Return to Paradise
programme.desc: A crime writer is found stabbed to death in his villa shortly after announcing his controversial comeback book at a literary festival. The officers soon discover all the suspects were on stage at the time of the murder. Detective drama, starring Anna Samson and Lloyd Griffith

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Professor Hannah Fry chairs the satirical current affairs quiz, with comedian Finlay Christie and the Rev Richard Coles joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the recent headlines

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Malcolm surprises Gemma and Sadie with a weekend away. Returning home from living in Spain, Malcolms estranged father Jackie invites himself along. Worn down by his fathers constant jibes and Gemmas disappointment at the holiday, Malcolm calls Derek for help. Between managing Dereks secret addiction and Jackie trying to recruit investors to his business, Malcolm enters the talent contest. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Blame Game
programme.desc: Tim McGarry, Colin Murphy, Diona Doherty and Neil Delamere are joined by comedy troubadour Emer Maguire to take a sideways look at the weeks news. Comedy asides and good craic abound as they turn their wit and satirical spin on the people and events making the news in Northern Ireland and beyond

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Comedian Alan Carr joins the host to discuss his recent projects, including his victory in Celebrity Traitors. Also appearing are Oscar-winner Kate Winslet, who discusses her role as first-time director of Christmas movie Goodbye June, former New Zealand politician Jacinda Ardern, whose documentary film Prime Minister tells the story of her five-year tenure at the top and US talk show host and podcaster Seth Meyers. Plus, Carrs fellow Traitor Cat Burns performs Theres Just Something About Her, from her album How to Be Human

programme.title: Last Christmas
programme.desc: Kate, an aspiring young singer who works a dead-end job as an elf at a Christmas shop in Central London, is made homeless after being evicted by her flatmate. Forced to live with her parents, she helps out at a homeless shelter and crosses paths with an enigmatic young man called Tom. However, their relationship proves far from straightforward. Director Paul Feigs romantic comedy, starring Emilia Clarke, Henry Golding, Michelle Yeoh and Emma Thompson, who also co-wrote the script

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Ben Lippett, Andi Oliver and Tasha Marrikar, and by special guests Ed Gamble and James Acaster. Helen McGinn pairs the wines with the studio dishes

programme.title: Mary at 90: A Lifetime of Cooking
programme.desc: Mary Berry comes to the culinary rescue of actor and comedian Kiell Smith-Bynoe, who loves to entertain but is more at home making cocktails than food. Marys four dinner party recipes are a canape of porcini mushroom arancini, roast salmon with parmesan crust and mushroom and white wine sauce, fillet tails of beef in Bearnaise sauce and chocolate roulade

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: A look ahead to the weekends matches, including Manchester City v Sunderland in the Premier League and the FA Cup second-round ties. Plus, news from the lunchtime games

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the opening semi-final from York Barbican, played over the best of 11 frames. Judd Trump lost the first two frames against Kyren Wilson at this stage last year, but fought back in style to win 6-2. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoons news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts this game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. The contestants are couple Emily and Mycul from Manchester, sisters Emefa and Zoe from London, and couple Ryan and Charles from Glasgow

programme.title: Robin Robin
programme.desc: An unhatched egg rolls into a rubbish dump and when the chick, Robin, emerges, she is raised by a family of thieving rodents. She grows up believing she is a mouse like her brothers and sisters, and tries to prove she can be just as sneaky. Animated adventure, with the voices of Bronte Carmichael, Richard E Grant and Gillian Anderson

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present the musicals special, in which contestants Amber Davies, Balvinder Sopal, George Clarke, Karen Carney and Lewis Cope take to the floor with performances inspired by the world of musical theatre - and after the fun of last weeks instant dance, they also face a new, high-stakes challenge. Judging their efforts are Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke. Plus, Tom Fletcher performs a song from the new musical adaptation of Paddington

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the game show in which contestants answer questions with the aid of celebrity experts - aware that one wrong answer means someone else gets a chance. Advising the contestants are Dermot OLeary, Anita Rani, Alex Brooker, Natalie Cassidy, Lucy Beaumont, Angela Scanlon and Mark Chapman

programme.title: Wild Cherry
programme.sub-title: Why Should We Be the Ones Shamed
programme.desc: The townsfolk come together in the wake of tragedy. As Grace and Allegra are questioned, mothers and daughters find themselves forced to lie to protect themselves. Lorna and Steven become closer when she finally reveals the truth of her past, but Juliets life falls apart when Gigi comes to dinner

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Aston Villa v Arsenal at Villa Park and Manchester City v Sunderland at Etihad Stadium. The Gunners were looking to emulate their 2-0 win over the Villans here last term, while their fellow title challengers City hosted a Sunderland side that had impressed in the top flight since their Championship play-off triumph last term. Plus, Bournemouth v Chelsea, Everton v Nottingham Forest, Newcastle United v Burnley, Tottenham Hotspur v Brentford and Leeds United v Liverpool

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: Kelly Somers has a conversation with USA manager Mauricio Pochettino, who has also had spells in charge of the likes of Chelsea, Tottenham Hotspur and Paris Saint-Germain

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: After the success of his comeback fight, Tommys road to redemption hits a major setback - his hand is injured again and needs eight weeks total rest before doctors will know if he can fight again. The last time he couldnt train, his life spiralled out of control, so now Tommy throws himself into a frenzy of activity - a TV appearance on The Wheel, family days out with Bambi and a final push to finish the home he hopes Molly and Bambi will soon return to

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys recovery is back on track after he and John put his hand to the test. The pair are training again, and the search for Tommys next opponent begins. Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mother out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up. Tommy reveals that John has had a recent health scare, so to cheer him up, father and son take their very different caravans to a local steam fair

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ruby Gillman, Teenage Kraken
programme.desc: Shy teenager Ruby Gillman is a kraken who lives on dry land in Oceanside with parents Arthur and Agatha and her younger brother Sam. A failed prom proposal culminates in Ruby plunging into the sea, and finally she discovers she is destined to inherit the throne from her kraken grandmother. Animated coming-of-age fantasy, featuring the voices of Lana Condor and Jane Fonda

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.sub-title: A Very Arondekar Christmas - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. A leaky water-heater mishap threatens to ruin festive holiday plans as Sam and Jay prepare to host Jays hard-to-please dad, difficult-to-impress mum and sister Bela. American version of the British comedy series, starring Utkarsh Ambudkar, Rose McIver and Brandon Scott Jones

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.sub-title: A Very Arondekar Christmas - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. A failed exorcism puts Jay in a vicarious position as Sam works to restore him. Meanwhile, Pete in possession of Jays body, is determined to see his daughter one last time. American version of the British comedy series, starring Utkarsh Ambudkar, Rose McIver and Brandon Scott Jones

programme.title: Here We Go
programme.desc: An awkward encounter with local artist Frank, commissioned by Rachel to paint a Jessop family portrait, leads to Sue buying a swimming pool to help her recover from her hip replacement. As Paul struggles with a month-long family detox set by Amy and Rachel attempts to fix the painting, in which she is convinced he deliberately made her look older, the pool is accidentally ruined on its maiden voyage. To make matters worse, Frank suddenly demands his painting back to include in a small exhibition. Hiding out at Cherrys new Salsa class, Rachel and Paul decide to pluck up the courage to deal with Frank, the pool and the detox in one evening

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Malcolm surprises Gemma and Sadie with a weekend away. Returning home from living in Spain, Malcolms estranged father Jackie invites himself along. Worn down by his fathers constant jibes and Gemmas disappointment at the holiday, Malcolm calls Derek for help. Between managing Dereks secret addiction and Jackie trying to recruit investors to his business, Malcolm enters the talent contest. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: The penultimate leg of the race is the longest so far, with the teams travelling from the islands of Bocas del Toro on northern Panamas Caribbean coast, to Medellín, Colombias second largest city. Standing in their way is the notorious and dangerous Darien Gap - their only option is to bypass it by sea, enduring a lengthy, arduous and costly boat journey, putting their dwindling budgets under pressure. On reaching the final country of the race, teams are confronted with another challenge to overcome - a heightened security risk on the route to Medellín

programme.title: The Impossible
programme.desc: A British family spends Christmas in Thailand, only to get caught up in the 2004 tsunami. While his mother lies injured in hospital, the eldest son ventures into the ensuing chaos to search for his father and younger brothers, whom he was separated from during the crisis. Drama, with Naomi Watts, Ewan McGregor and Tom Holland

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: With the obvious vote to finish what they started, Water are ready to get rid of Ben once and for all. However, the lines in the sand are always shifting as Ben debates his alliance to his OG Blood v the new Kid on the block

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: A group of 24 Australians are stranded on a remote island with challenges to complete with the winner taking home $500,000. The votes might seem obvious in the game of Blood v Water, but only for whose responsible for staying in the game

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys recovery is back on track after he and John put his hand to the test. The pair are training again, and the search for Tommys next opponent begins. Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mother out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up. Tommy reveals that John has had a recent health scare, so to cheer him up, father and son take their very different caravans to a local steam fair

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Malcolm surprises Gemma and Sadie with a weekend away. Returning home from living in Spain, Malcolms estranged father Jackie invites himself along. Worn down by his fathers constant jibes and Gemmas disappointment at the holiday, Malcolm calls Derek for help. Between managing Dereks secret addiction and Jackie trying to recruit investors to his business, Malcolm enters the talent contest. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Corey Bakers Dance Race
programme.desc: The New Zealand classical and contemporary choreographer and former dancer is known for his films featuring dance in striking and unexpected locations. The UKs dance artists, from classical ballet dancers and Strictly Come Dancing stars to choreographed skydivers and car-eographed drivers, race across the country to meet Lady G in Coreys thrilling film

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Festive special from Christmas 2006. The Doctor, fresh from his painful separation from Rose, is stunned when bride-to-be Donna (Catherine Tate in her first appearance on the show) mysteriously materialises aboard the Tardis. However, the resulting race to get her to the church on time takes a sinister turn when aliens kidnap the unfortunate woman. Sarah Parish also guest stars, with David Tennant

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Bryn is in his element as he awaits the arrival of the Essex boys, who are having a big night out in Cardiff and staying for a sleepover, but Smithy is concerned about seeing Nessa again after their last meeting. Meanwhile, Stacey tells Gavin about a worrying discovery, and Pam and Mick discuss their plans for a new conservatory

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Everyone gathers in Billericay as Pete and Dawn prepare to renew their wedding vows. Gavin feels uncomfortable about Gwen and Bryn knowing the details of his sex life, and Dave hears about the shocking events of the curry night. Meanwhile, Smithy goes beyond the call of friendship when he makes a staggering suggestion

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Bank Holiday Monday sees the Essex contingent arrive for a sunny day at the beach in Barry. Gavin has a heart-to-heart with his dad, which gives him much to think about, while a dark cloud looms on the horizon when Dave arrives to find Nessa and Smithy enjoying all the fun of the fair. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones star

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Preparations for Nessa and Daves wedding are in full swing, Stacey has life-changing news for Gavin, and Bryn and Jason put their big secret to bed once and for all. Finally, the wedding arrives and, as Nessa prepares to make her way to the church, Smithy takes the opportunity to have one last chat. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden, Ruth Jones and Rob Brydon star

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Longing for her old life, Gemma tries reliving a past night out, only to realise she has changed for ever and misses Sadie. Malcolm assumes babysitting duties, only to find his evening upturned by Derek, who ropes the grandfather into helping him exact revenge on his ex-wife. In an attempt to support his friend, while keeping Sadie safe from all perceived threats, Malcolm panics when Gemma announces she is coming home early. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Malcolm surprises Gemma and Sadie with a weekend away. Returning home from living in Spain, Malcolms estranged father Jackie invites himself along. programme.title: Last Christmas
programme.desc: Kate, an aspiring young singer who works a dead-end job as an elf at a Christmas shop in Central London, is made homeless after being evicted by her flatmate. Forced to live with her parents, she helps out at a homeless shelter and crosses paths with an enigmatic young man called Tom. However, their relationship proves far from straightforward. Director Paul Feigs romantic comedy, starring Emilia Clarke, Henry Golding, Michelle Yeoh and Emma Thompson, who also co-wrote the script

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Just as Janet begins to feel ready to go on with her life after Jonnys death, Louise reveals she has been hiding all of her post for six months - and among the unopened letters is a repossession order for Janets house. With only 24 hours to save her home, she seeks the help of Aidan, a bumbling local villain who has come into money after robbing a post office

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: While Donna is away in London at a job interview, Gaz enlists Janets aid to inject some much-needed sophistication into his new home, but as the two decorate, their mutual attraction begins to resurface. Louise is alone when she goes into labour, and attempts to become her own birthing partner

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Janet struggles to make the right decision when Gaz confesses his love to her. On discovering Gazs relationship with Janet, Donna vandalises his van - but has an affair of her own to hide. Meanwhile, Munch tries to find a suitable birthing expert to help Louise

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: The former footballer visits some of the worlds most dangerous cities to explore the issues that affect young men born into a life on the fringes of society. He begins in the favelas of Rio, Brazil, where he learns what it takes to become a lookout, foot soldier and drug dealer in a world where death could become reality at any moment. He also comes face-to-face with a gun-toting militia boss to uncover how these men rule through fear and intimidation

programme.title: Stick Man
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of the childrens book by author Julia Donaldson and illustrator Axel Scheffler, the creators of modern classic The Gruffalo. It follows the title character on an incredible adventure across the seasons as he runs from a playful dog, gets thrown into a river, escapes from a swans nest and even ends up on top of a fire. Will he ever get back to his family in time for Christmas? Martin Freeman heads the voice cast as Stick Man, with Hugh Bonneville, Russell Tovey, Rob Brydon and Sally Hawkins, plus Jennifer Saunders as the narrator

programme.title: Zog

Each year he meets a kindly young girl who patches up his bumps and bruises, but can she help him with his trickiest challenge yet? Its year five and he has to capture a princess. Animated adaptation of Julia Donaldson and Axel Schefflers book, featuring the voices of Lenny Henry, Tracey Ullman, Hugh Skinner, Patsy Ferran and Kit Harington

programme.title: The Snail and the Whale
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of Julia Donaldson and Axel Schefflers childrens book. Sally Hawkins and Rob Brydon head the voice cast as the title characters, with Cariad Lloyd and Diana Rigg

programme.title: The Gruffalo
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of Julia Donaldsons best-selling childrens book. It tells the tale of a little mouse who takes a walk through the woods in search of a nut, only to encounter a fox, an owl and a snake who all want to eat him. To escape their clutches, the quick-witted rodent creates an imaginary monster to scare away his attackers - but it turns out to be all too real. Robbie Coltrane heads the voice cast as the Gruffalo, with James Corden as the Mouse and Rob Brydon, John Hurt and Tom Wilkinson as the predators

programme.title: The Gruffalos Child
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of the sequel to Julia Donaldsons best-selling childrens book, reuniting all the voice cast from the original. The Gruffalo has raised his daughter on tales of the big, bad mouse, the only creature in the forest he is frightened of. Despite her fathers warnings, she sets off in search of this scary creature, along the way encountering the snake, owl and the fox. But when she still has no luck finding the evil rodent, she begins to think he does not exist after all. Robbie Coltrane, James Corden and Rob Brydon lend their voices, with Shirley Henderson as Gruffalo Jr

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep: The Flight Before Christmas
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve at Mossy Bottom Farm, but Shauns seasonal excitement turns to dismay when a farmhouse raid to get bigger stockings inadvertently leads to Timmy heading off to a Christmas market in the back of the farmers truck. Shaun sets out to get his cousin back before he becomes someone elses present. Animated adventure, with the voices of Justin Fletcher and Marcus Brigstocke

Starring Cian Eagle-Service, Peter Serafinowicz, Harry Enfield and Jameela Jamil

Suzanne shares her brilliant batch-cooking secrets, from a spectacular lobster mac and cheese party dish to a hotel-worthy family breakfast and the ultimate make-ahead Christmas feast, all the while saving time, money and sanity. programme.sub-title: A 70s Christmas: Those Were the Days
programme.desc: A trip down memory lane revealing what Christmas was like in the 1970s, with contributions from broadcaster Angela Rippon and Slade guitarist Dave Hill and a host of experts and historians. The programme reveals what was served up for dinner, what was on TV, the most popular presents found under the tree and the tunes that topped the charts. Plus, the Hastings from Surrey are challenged to put away their smartphones and immerse themselves in a Christmas of the 1970s, making Christmas decorations inspired by Blue Peter, trying the hit boardgame Mastermind, tackling a frozen turkey, tucking into Tunis cake and finding out how easy it really is to bounce on a space hopper

programme.title: The 1970s Dinner Party: Youre All Invited
programme.desc: A trip back to the golden age of dinner parties, with Debbie McGee hosting Johnny Ball, Cheryl Baker, Vicki Michelle and Leee John at a 1970s-style gathering, sampling retro recipes from chef Rustie Lee. The guests tuck into fondue with crepes suzette, reflecting on and learning about a decade in which more Brits became homeowners, furniture became fashionable and food was flamboyant

programme.title: Inside Hampton Court Palace
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at royal Christmas celebrations past and present. Chief Curator Tracy Borman explores traditions that date back to the reign of Henry VIII, from blessing the giant shire horses to bringing in the mistletoe from the Home Park. The programme reveals how traditional greenery is still brought in to decorate the palace, just as it would have been in Tudor times, and reveals the carol service that takes place in the Chapel Royal

programme.title: Royal Births, Marriages and Deaths
programme.desc: A look at the secrets sewn into the Duchess of Sussexs wedding gown, the shocking death of George V at the hands of his own doctor, the trial of Anne Boleyn that led to her execution, and the birth of Prince Philip on a dining table in Corfu in the middle of an uprising

programme.title: Christmas TV We Loved and Lost
programme.desc: Unwrapping the best of Christmas television gone by - from the 1960s through to the early 1990s - remembering a time when, with audiences often topping 20 million, Christmas TV really was national appointment viewing. Narrated by Hayley Tamaddon and featuring Susan Calman, Lucy Porter, Jeremy Vine, Vanessa Feltz, Richard Blackwood, Cheryl Baker, Debbie McGee, John Sergeant, Rob and Dave Nicholson, and Rufus Hound, the programme celebrates the unmissable entertainment, hilarious comedy, gripping soap storylines and blockbuster movies that defined the golden age of Christmas TV

programme.title: The Most Embarrassing TV Moments
programme.desc: Celebrating TV cock-ups, mishaps and gaffes, including Bill Oddie getting flustered by technical issues on breakfast TV and Feargal Sharkey suffering a sound failure while attempting the first live broadcast from a jumbo jet. There is a look at often painful attempts made by politicians to show their human side on the small screen, including David Mellor, Jeffrey Archer and Matt Hancock, and there are also clips of Joan Rivers storming off, Quentin Tarantino coming up with a new form of torture for Krishnan Guru-Murthy, and Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby valiantly keeping straight faces as an alien lands in the This Morning studio

programme.title: Celebs at Christmas: How Do They Do It?

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: In a series of flashbacks celebrating the shows 200th episode, it is revealed how Ted first met his future wife, and how they share a history of missed connections, especially after he was introduced to her room-mate Cindy (Rachel Bilson). The couple realise they have had many of the same friends and acquaintances over the years. American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy about scientists and their friendship with a down-to-earth neighbour. When aspiring actress Penny moves into Leonards apartment block, he is immediately smitten, but Sheldon warns him that he runs the risk of a broken heart if he tries to woo her. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby enthusiast Andy and dental nurse Holly kick off the competition in Yorkshire with a Mexican fiesta - a fun-filled evening, but with a few blunders in the kitchen. Day two sees married couple Mitesh and Jess cooking up an Indian-inspired meal, but with a couple of spice-fearing guests, they have a tough crowd to please. Finally, its the turn of Yorkshire couple Paul and Mandy to host with some `proper grub". After two nights of Paul larking around he has a few surprises in and out of the kitchen to try to secure the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

Estate agents Princess Trish and her partner Alan cook a glamorous fine-dining menu on the seond night. Alan is a real romantic and he tells his guests how far he will go to show his love for Trish, revealing his tattoos of devotion. Finally, fiances Marc and Dan put on a musical-themed feast, hoping Marcs nanas egg sauce, which has been passed down through generations, will be enough to win them the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Los Angeles to help La Frite, an outdated French restaurant that is failing to make any profits. His first step is to try to reconcile the feuding family members who run the business, and so devises a plan to bring them together by using secret filming

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Belfast couple David and Conna first met in New Zealand, when they bumped into each other during a night out in Wellington. Five years later, they are planning to tie the knot, and Conna has decided to give David the chance to prove his organisational skills by giving him charge of their wedding. However, while the bride is hoping for a simple, classic ceremony, the groom has decided a lavish Narnia-themed event is the order of the day, complete with a lion, a witch, a wardrobe and a pink fire brigade

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Groom-to-be Gavin attempts to pull off a Thai-themed wedding in Somerset, while his fiancee Sophie dreams of a rustic, romantic affair

The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen

programme.title: Derry Girls

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor, Alyson Hannigan and Neil Patrick Harris

American sitcom, guest starring Tracey Ullman and Jon Heder

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of Lelas, a Pomona, California, restaurant that is currently being run into the ground by its inexperienced owner. Gordon tries to turn the failing business around, but faces opposition from the chef and makes enemies when he exposes the suspect behaviour of some members of staff

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to transform the fortunes of Sebastians, a pizzeria in Burbank, Los Angeles, which is failing to attract customers, leaving the owner in debt and struggling to support his family. Gordon is horrified to discover pre-processed and frozen ingredients on the menu, but there seems to be little he can do to help when he is thrown out of the kitchen

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of Finn McCools, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, New York. The chances of the establishment becoming a success are being ruined by the owner Buddy Mazzios two sons, bartender Jason and chef Brian, who are constantly fighting with each other, prompting Gordon to have a heart-to-heart with the family

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Howard attempt to distract Sheldon with a trip to a historic railway when he slows the progress of their work on the Air Force guidance system. Raj and Stuart look after baby Halley, while Penny and Amy take Bernadette out

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is furious when she learns that Sheldon has shared intimate details of their relationship with his colleagues at the university, prompting their first fight since moving in together. Raj considers trying to live without financial support from his father, who thinks he is spoilt

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Cut off from his fathers fortune, Raj struggles to balance his books, so decides to appoint Sheldon to organise his finances and get him out of debt. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con because she thinks Leonard wants her to come along

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldons old room to Raj after he is forced to move out of his apartment to save money, leading to unexpected conflict among the gang and some unwanted observations from Leonards mother. Christine Baranski guests

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, but Penny and Raj get along so well together that Leonard starts to feel left out. Sheldon expresses an interest in Amys work and they begin to collaborate on a scientific project

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood, Prue Leith and Matt Lucas are joined by Tom Allen to celebrate Christmas in the famous white tent. Joining in the festivities are Jamie and Rosie from 2019, Ruby from 2018 and James from 2017, all back and ready to battle in the festive fight for the Christmas Star Baker title. Plus, Alexandra Burke performs her magical version of Silent Night

programme.title: Bumblebee
programme.desc: In 1987, lonely Californian teenager Charlie Watson is traumatised by the death of her father and resentful of her mother Sallys relationship with new boyfriend Ronald. For her 18th-birthday shes given a yellow Volkswagen Beetle, which turns out to be the battle-scarred Autobot Bumblebee. Transformers prequel, starring Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Jorge Lendeborg Jr

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer bowls a perfect 300 game and becomes a local hero, giving speeches to classes of schoolchildren and appearing on TV show Springfield Squares - but it is not long before fame goes to his head. With the voices of Penn and Teller and Ron Howard

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Apu becomes the proud father of octuplets and enjoys being showered with free gifts from companies that want him to endorse their products - until a couple in nearby Shelbyville go one better by having nine children. Cartoon capers, featuring the voice of former Munsters actor Butch Patrick

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Barts antics with family dog Santas Little Helper cause mayhem, and ultimately result in Principal Skinner getting the sack and eternal do-gooder Ned Flanders being appointed in his place

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Boy Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: Mayor Quimbys nephew is wrongly accused of assault, presenting Bart with a dilemma - if he volunteers the information that would clear the lads name, he risks being expelled from school for playing truant

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family celebrates Maggies birthday. Bart steals Homers wallet to pay for an Itchy and Scratchy souvenir, and Grandma Bouvier is swept off her feet by Grampa - but Mr Burns provides romantic competition, convinced she is the woman for him

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer teaches an adult education course on the secrets of marital bliss. However, Marge spoils it by kicking him out of the house for revealing intimate domestic details to his students

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Angry dolphins attack Springfield on Halloween, while Homer dies and has to perform one good deed before he can get into Heaven. Bart and Lisa meet characters from fairy tales

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics cast their eyes over some of the biggest shows aired during the festive season. Including The Real Full Monty on Ice, Would I Lie to You at Christmas?, Inside KFC at Christmas, The Sound of Music, Penguins: Meet the Family, Fanny Cradock Cooks for Christmas, The Chase Celebrity Christmas Special, Final Destination, Gordon, Gino and Fred: Desperately Seeking Santa, A Perfect Planet, and Home Alone 2: Lost in New York

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics settle down to a selection of the past weeks TV shows, focusing their attentions on Slow Horses, Celebrity Race Across the World, Dating Naked, The Teacher, 90 Day Fiance, Police Interceptors, and news reports about Kier Starmer and the stranded Boeing Starliner astronauts

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions of shows including Celebrity Race Across the World, Nightsleeper, Married at First Sight UK, Selling Sunset, Nadiyas Cook Once, Eat Twice, Jack Whitehall: Fatherhood with My Father and Haunted Hospitals

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Divorced couple Stuart and Mandy arrive in the restaurant to offer each other moral support as they try to find love again. Mandy wants an adventurer to whisk her off her feet, and her date, globetrotting Adam, could be just the ticket. Across the restaurant, sparks are also flying as Stuarts cheeky humour has fellow divorcee Claire in stitches. Meanwhile, 30-year-old financial manager J meets aesthetic therapist Sophie, and 23-year-old Nathan has his work cut out to try and win over 21-year-old Morganne

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Recruitment consultant Lee sits down for a meal with Abbi, who lives a more civilised lifestyle than he does. Septuagenarian Deanna, who hasnt been on a date in 20 years, meets ex-car mechanic Alex, but he seems more interested in the waiter than in her, while beauty ambassador Bianca is paired with Teza, who prides himself on being an entertainer, but admits that his cockiness is a mask for his own insecurity

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics cast their eyes over some of the biggest shows aired during the festive season. Including The Real Full Monty on Ice, Would I Lie to You at Christmas?, Inside KFC at Christmas, The Sound of Music, Penguins: Meet the Family, Fanny Cradock Cooks for Christmas, The Chase Celebrity Christmas Special, Final Destination, Gordon, Gino and Fred: Desperately Seeking Santa, A Perfect Planet, and Home Alone 2: Lost in New York

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys India
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley travels back to the country of her birth, travelling the length and breadth of India to explore its diverse landscapes and cultural traditions. In this episode, her epic journey begins in Tamil Nadu, where she witnesses religious ceremonies in glorious temples, before visiting Gangtok in Sikkim, the place where her mother lived as a child

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys India
programme.desc: Joanna meets the Maharaja of Dungarpur who shows her around his lakeside palace, and a Dalit community in Gujarat, considered to be Indias lowest caste. Braving the roads of Mumbai, Joanna takes a ride in the citys only all-female taxi company and visits the Times of India, where her uncle was editor of the paper in the 1930s and 40s. She then overcomes her fear of heights to explore the World One Tower, soon to be Mumbais tallest luxury residential building

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys India
programme.desc: Joannas adventures across India conclude as she explores Rajasthan, Delhi and the mountainous North West, before ending in Kashmir, the place of her birth. Her first stop takes her to the Ranthambhore National Park, where she learns about the Wildlife Protection Society of Indias tiger conservation programmes. Joannas next stop takes her to the city of Delhi, where she begins her exploration of the capital at Humayuns Tomb, before ending her 5000 mile journey in Srinagar in Kashmi, the place where she was born

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Japan
programme.desc: Joanna begins a 2,000-mile journey across Japan in Hokkaido, where she meets one of the most important animals in Japanese culture, the red-crowned crane. She arrives in Sapporo during the middle of the annual Snow Festival and meets members of the local indigenous community, before travelling into the Fukushima exclusion zone and taking a bullet train from Nagano to Tokyo

programme.desc: Jim is horrified at allegations of phone-tapping and emphatically denies they are true - until Sir Humphrey informs him otherwise. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the regions few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascars unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: A couple whose daughter was born deaf and mute decide to enrol her in a special class in the hope that she might learn to speak. The difficulties they face in raising their child expose the tensions within their marriage. Drama based on the novel The Day Is Ours by Hilda Lewis, starring Phyllis Calvert, Jack Hawkins, Mandy Miller and Terence Morgan

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: An ambassadors son idolises his fathers butler, and tries to throw the police off his scent when he is suspected of murder. However, the boys actions only make the servant seem more suspicious, and he begins to realise that his hero may have deceived him. Crime drama, starring Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey

programme.title: Nicholas Nickleby
programme.desc: A young man is sent by his cruel uncle to work at a school, but is appalled by the brutality of the headmaster and flees with one of the abused pupils. He takes up with a troupe of travelling actors, and once more runs into his uncle, who is trying to force a woman into marriage. Period drama based on Charles Dickens novel, with Derek Bond and Cedric Hardwicke

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: Cowboys and Aliens
programme.desc: A Wild-West town dominated by a cattle baron comes under attack by invaders from another world. It falls to a mysterious stranger with no memory to unite the townsfolk, a gang of outlaws and an Apache tribe, in a bid to fight back against the aliens, and learn the truth about his own past. Sci-fi Western, with Daniel Craig, Harrison Ford, Olivia Wilde and Sam Rockwell

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane visits Los Angeles to see his family over the Christmas holiday. Stopping off at his wifes place of work, he realises armed men have taken over the building and are holding the corporations staff to ransom - and only he has the ability to fight back. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman and Bonnie Bedelia

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: A Brooklyn bartender secretly provides a service delivering shipments of money to local gangsters. His criminal connections lead to his involvement in a robbery that goes disastrously wrong and digs up the long-buried secrets from his neighbourhoods past. Crime drama based on a short story by Dennis Lehane, starring Tom Hardy, Noomi Rapace and James Gandolfini in his final film role

programme.title: You Were Never Really Here
programme.desc: A former soldier is haunted by memories of abuse and suicidal fantasies, but uses his military skills to rescue abducted girls whose families dont want to involve the authorities. His latest contract is to liberate a senators teenage daughter, who has been trafficked into a brothel. Lynne Ramsays psychological thriller, starring Joaquin Phoenix, with Ekaterina Samsonov and Judith Roberts.

programme.title: Home Alone 3
programme.desc: Cheeky eight-year-old Alex Pruitt is delighted to be given a remote-controlled toy car by his neighbour - unaware it contains a stolen microchip. A gang of crooks heads to Alexs town with the intention of recovering the valuable item, but the resourceful youngster has prepared for their arrival with a series of nasty booby-traps. Comedy sequel, starring Alex D Linz, Olek Krupa, Rya Kihlstedt and Lenny von Dohlen

programme.title: Animal Farm
programme.desc: Animals rebel against their unscrupulous owner and take control of his farm, vowing to run things fairly, with equality for all. However, the pigs leading the revolt succumb to greed and corruption, culminating in violence and oppression. Animated drama based on George Orwells novel, narrated by Gordon Heath and with Maurice Denham providing the voices for all the characters

programme.title: The Call of the Wild
programme.desc: A crossbreed dog stolen from his Californian home and taken north to the Yukon, where there is great demand for strong dogs to pull sleds in the frozen wilderness. As his new owner ventures deeper into the Arctic circle, the dog must rediscover his primal nature as a wild animal to survive. Historical adventure based on Jack Londons novel, starring Harrison Ford and Omar Sy

programme.title: The Northman Interview Special
programme.desc: Alexander Skarsgard, Anya Taylor-Joy and director Robert Eggers talk about making their Viking adventure

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine OHara and John Candy

programme.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
programme.desc: Hapless youngster Kevin somehow manages to catch the wrong plane and finds himself heading for New York, while his family jets off to Florida. Having got his hands on his fathers credit card, he is enjoying the good life staying in a luxury hotel - until he bumps into two familiar burglars with an axe to grind. Comedy sequel, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, Brenda Fricker and Tim Curry

programme.title: Memory
programme.desc: Veteran hitman Alex Lewis decides to retire as he confronts the symptoms of Alzheimers, which has already reduced his brother Bill to a catatonic state in a nursing home. He reluctantly accepts one final job, to kill a lawyer in possession of an incriminating flash drive - but finds the mission violates his code. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Guy Pearce and Monica Bellucci

programme.title: The Northman
programme.desc: Prince Amleth, the son of the murdered Viking King Aurvandill War-Raven, heads to cold, windswept Iceland to retrieve what was stolen from him - a father, a mother, and a kingdom. Amleth embarks on a murderous quest to find the hateful adversary, whose life is for ever woven together with his by the hands of fate. Historical adventure, starring Alexander Skarsgard, Nicole Kidman, Claes Bang and Ethan Hawke

programme.title: The Masque of the Red Death
programme.desc: A cruel prince, who immerses himself in the black arts and terrorises the peasantry, holds a masked ball at his castle, where his wealthy guests take refuge from the plague ravaging the countryside - but a mysterious red-robed figure lurks in the shadows. The late Roger Cormans adaptation of Edgar Allan Poes horror story, with Vincent Price, Jane Asher and Patrick Magee

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Mano goes after an old friend who has killed an Apache family for their scalps, jeopardising a peace treaty

programme.title: Cat Ballou
programme.desc: A schoolteacher returns to her home town to find a ruthless railroad developer is trying to snatch her familys land. When her father is murdered by a hitman for refusing to sell his ranch, she resolves to defend the property, enlisting the aid of two small-time crooks and a drunken gunslinger with an equally inebriated horse. Musical comedy Western, starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin, with music by Nat King Cole and Stubby Kaye

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: The ranch hands are tricked into crossing the border into Mexico, where they are all taken prisoner and Manolito is sentenced to death by firing squad

programme.title: The Return of Frank James
programme.desc: Former outlaw Frank James becomes a reformed character, but when his brothers killers are pardoned, he takes up his guns once more to carry out his own brand of justice. He is followed on his quest by a smitten female reporter who wants to record his story. Fritz Langs Western sequel stars Henry Fonda, reprising his role from 1939 movie Jesse James, alongside Gene Tierney and Jackie Cooper

programme.title: This Week Back Then
programme.desc: How news bulletins used to look. The GREAT! network takes viewers back in time, remembering stories from this week back then

programme.title: The Return of Frank James
programme.desc: Former outlaw Frank James becomes a reformed character, but when his brothers killers are pardoned, he takes up his guns once more to carry out his own brand of justice. He is followed on his quest by a smitten female reporter who wants to record his story. Fritz Langs Western sequel stars Henry Fonda, reprising his role from 1939 movie Jesse James, alongside Gene Tierney and Jackie Cooper

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired to find a 10-year-old girls father, who she refuses to believe is dead. Classic Western drama, starring Steve McQueen as a compassionate bounty hunter

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A concerned father hires Josh to retrieve his son, a passionate young man whose gift for rousing rhetoric is being used by plunderers to recruit freedom fighters

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: After Hollister takes a wounded youth to Tombstones hospital, the notorious Gayleyville gang kidnap him and the nurse aiding him. Hollister and the wounded man attempt to save the nurse

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Fragments of the local paper are found at a robbery scene and on a body of a known killer; Hollister uncovers a code in the help wanted ads and lays a trap to smoke out a robbery gang

programme.title: The High Chaparral

programme.title: The Persuaders!

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.sub-title: The Village That Rose from the Dead
programme.desc: Christmas special of the detective drama from 2016. The village of Little Auburn has stood abandoned since the Second World War, but now plans are afoot to restore it to its former glory via three competing projects. It is left to local landowner Roderick Craven to determine which scheme will win out, but on the eve of his big decision, one of the project leaders is murdered. DCI Barnaby and his new partner DS Jamie Winter are soon on the case, and when death stalks the streets of Little Auburn again, Barnaby and Winter are dragged into a web of conspiracy involving fraud, deadly snakes, and Rodericks estranged brother, Milo (guest star Hugh Dennis). Neil Dudgeon stars, with Nick Hendrix making his debut as Barnabys latest assistant

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Dr Liz Merrick is mortified when one of her patients dies of an insulin overdose, but even more so when Sgt Merton is forced to investigate her responsibility. Meanwhile, Vernon Scripps embarks on a mission to make Aidensfield sparkle with his own brand of cleaning products. Drama, starring Aislin McGuckin and Duncan Bell

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve comes to the aid of an amnesiac struggling to piece together his identity, Jenny tells Dennis she is tired of playing second fiddle to his career, and Bernie and David step in when it appears Vernons money-making schemes are getting the better of him. programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

programme.desc: Todd returns to the Street to take up his invitation to the stag do and wedding, Fiz decides Chesney should move in with her, and Paul arrives at the restaurant with a black eye.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Angus, a member of the Bleakridge Watch, a group of villagers who walk the streets reporting anyone who falls foul of the law, is found dead in his meat freezer. Barnaby and Winter meet Anguss devastated sister and her daughter and learn that Angus was investigating a recent spate of burglaries in the village, but had yet to identify the culprit. Angus post-mortem reveals strange restraining injuries on his wrists and the plot thickens as Barnaby discovers just how far some people will go for power. Frances Barber guest stars as the leader of the Watch

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Alf Ventress mounts a large-scale surveillance operation in an effort to track down the wool thief responsible for de-fleecing sheep in Aidensfield. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A serious assault leads the police to foil an attempt to steal antiques from Ashfordly Hall, and Vernon goes all-out to persuade a wealthy woman to make a charitable contribution toward his donkey sanctuary - but the discovery that there is already one in the area forces him to change his plans. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The launch of the latest sparkling wine by Midsomer Vinae Winery falls flat when critic Nadia Simons gives it a scathing review, then guests sampling the vintage start to collapse. Owner William Carnarvon suspects the Farmers Wives Association of trying to destroy his business, while his wife Diana frets over her mother Matilda, one of the victims. Pathologist Kate reveals the drink was laced with slug poison, but how is the attack connected to the death of a child in a hit-and-run? Barnaby and Nelson are called in to investigate. Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee star in the mystery drama, with Claire Bloom, Mark Bonnar, Rosie Cavaliero and Ruth Gemmell

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Gerald Hadleigh, the secretary of the local writers circle in the tranquil village of Midsomer Worthy, is found battered to death on the eve of a visit by a best-selling novelist. Barnaby and Troy discover Hadleigh was a mystery man, with no relatives or marriage certificate to match the wedding photo on display in his house. To make matters worse, another body is then found. Mystery, guest starring Anna Massey and Una Stubbs

The situation becomes more serious when a housewife dies of the same condition. Endeavour investigates a family-run supermarket, believing the infection may have stemmed from their stock being deliberately contaminated, and discovers dark secrets that may have a connection to the unexplained blaze

Then it comes to light the victim recently announced plans to move the event to a new location, which would have cost local entrepreneur Frank Wainwright dearly. programme.title: Vera

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Dennis Waterman and former Corrie actress Georgia Taylor guest star in this special festive edition of the popular rural drama. A retired mountaineer (Waterman) still grieving over his sons death in a climbing accident gets a pleasant surprise when his student daughter (Taylor) returns for the holidays. But an even bigger shock is yet to come - not only is she pregnant, but the father-to-be is the very man her dad blames for her brothers demise. Meanwhile, the local women grow fed up with their menfolk when they arrive back from a booze run the worse for drink, prompting them to hang up their aprons and hand over all the Christmas organisation to the fellas. Beth doesnt know what to think when a patient predicts the new year will bring her and Tom the joy they have longed for, and romance is in the air for David and Anna. Lesley Dunlop, Philip Middlemiss, Kerrie Taylor and Samantha Giles star

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Carpenter Chris and electrician Jorrell get paired up and are given a three-bedroom detached house in the mining village of Wednesbury in the West Midlands. They have six months and a budget of £35,000 to turn a profit. But the renovation game is a gamble and with the UK housing market in freefall, will they get the renovation over the line before yet another interest rate hike?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lyn kicks off the week by serving an intriguingly named soup. Will her guests competitive spirit knock Lyns confidence at her summer solstice shenanigans?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kin hosts the second night in Oxford with hopes that his Asian-inspired menu and lucky red theme will win over his guests and ensure his victory. Jess struggles with her chopsticks and Alex cant stomach the soy pudding dessert but when Kin forgets to marinade his pork, everyone is left with dry meat

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kitchen designer Jess plans a sophisticated menu on the third night in Oxford - but unfortunately, her soggy souffles do not go unnoticed by student Kin

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the fourth night in Oxford, fundraiser Monica sets out to take her guests on a culinary world tour adventure. However, from the moment Ben walks in and claims hes going to win the £1,000 prize, tensions rise. Kitchen designer Jess is blown away by Monicas food, but PhD student Kin is disappointed theres not more spice, but Ben certainly adds some when he accuses retired teacher Lyn of not being very interesting

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the final night from Oxford and the turn of recruitment consultant and radio show host Ben to try and grab the grand. Theres plenty of chaos in the kitchen, which sees the tuna overcooked, and Ben desperately trying to save his night with a sweet-and-fiery cottage pie

programme.title: Four in a Bed
