programme.title: James Mays Man Lab
programme.desc: The host tries to redeem the reputation of modern men, who he believes are perceived as being unreliable, clumsy and oafish, by teaching them skills cherished by their forefathers. His first group of students faces challenges including defusing an unexploded bomb, serenading a woman, building a kitchen out of concrete and creating a motorised picnic table

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers in Progreso detain a man who makes a dash back towards Mexico, and the team in Laredo uncovers methamphetamine concealed in a shipment of landscaping stone

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A man wanted for serious sexual offences is apprehended in Progreso, and agents intercept a group of migrants moments after they cross the Rio Grande river

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Speed with Guy Martin: F1 Special
programme.desc: Ahead of the new Formula 1 season on Channel 4 this weekend, Guy Martin goes head to head with racing legend David Coulthard in the ultimate test of bike against car. With David in a Red Bull RB8 Formula 1 car and Guy on his Tyco BMW Superbike, the pair race in a series of challenges including a drag race, a brake test, slalom and a full-on circuit race. Theres also entertainment in the pit as they compete in physical and mental challenges, testing their fitness and reaction times and exploring the science behind their chosen racing machines

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Speed with Guy Martin: F1 Challenge
programme.desc: The motorcycle racer joins a pit crew during the 2017 Belgian Grand Prix, providing behind the scenes insight into the world of Formula One. Guy has to work on the split second timing that allows a team to change four tyres in 1.92 seconds, with each individual mechanic as many as 34 different actions without getting in each others way, and also takes on the most dangerous job on the crew - stepping in front of speeding vehicles to remove tyres as soon as they stop

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers face a harrowing situation as a family from Venezuela pleads with them to enter America. In Progreso, a suspected drug dealer is caught smuggling pills in his underpants

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: More than 100 boxes full of drugs are discovered inside an unlikely vehicle at the World Trade Bridge. In Progreso, a suspected gang member attempts to cross into the United States

programme.title: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: In Melbourne, the busy SCT maintenance team expect the unexpected every day as they provision, inspect and shunt engines in and out of a bustling maintenance pit

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff transforms a Sinclair C5 into a bobsleigh and tackles a terrifying Norwegian luge track. Elsewhere, the team sample some classic TV cop cars, before going head-to-head in an all-action police chase

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness set out to qualify as lorry drivers, before embarking on a stormy HGV road trip across Britain, and a spot of truck racing. Out on the track, Chris runs the rule over the beautiful new Lotus Emira

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers forage for food, exploring Britains fields and hedgerows in search of free ingredients that will form the basis of spectacular dishes

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the King Harry ferry to enjoy a crossing voted one of the most scenic in the world, rustles up a vegetarian tart and investigates the Cornish influence on Oscar-Winning composer Malcolm Arnold with Radio 3 presenter Petroc Trelawny

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick delves into the stories of those who worked in Cornwalls mines, from the men who laboured beneath the earths surface to the young women who earned their living breaking rocks with heavy sledgehammers. He also visits a maker of botanical spirits, and adds a cheeky nip to his clementine trifle

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Maisie Adam, Ivo Graham, Dev Griffin and Zoe Lyons test their general knowledge skills before Richard Osman announces the weeks victor

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Angela Barnes, Kemah Bob, Ade Edmondson and Beattie Edmondson test their general knowledge skills before Richard Osman announces the weeks winner

programme.title: Clash of the Comics
programme.desc: Professional wrestling action, with some of the biggest names in comedy wrestling against each other and some of the UKs top wrestlers at the Hammersmith Apollo in London. The card features Ed Gamble wrestling against Phil Wang in the headline title match, James Acaster issuing an open challenge to fight any comedian or wrestler who can handle him, and Maisie Adam facing multi-time champion wrestler Nina Samuels. Other comedians taking part include Max Olesker, Ivan Gonzalez, Ania Magliano, Harriet Kemsley, Amy Gledhill, Sarah Keyworth, Abi Clarke, Max Fosh, Mark Silcox, Adam Kay, Rose Matafeo and Rosie Jones. There is commentary in the venue from Greg James, Sara Pascoe and Nish Kumar, backstage reporting from Olga Koch and Matthew Crosby, Ivo Graham as the event emcee, and Joe Lycett as the events CEO.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Susan Calman, Hal Cruttenden and Romesh Ranganathan on an edition of the comedy quiz first aired in July 2014. The panellists give their take on that weeks major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.sub-title: 8 Out of 10 Cats: Jimmy, Sean and Jons Best Bits
programme.desc: One-off special revisiting highlights from the 2014 series of the comedy panel show, with presenter Jimmy Carr, team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson and a host of celebrity guests. Stars who appeared during the run included Louis Smith, Rob Beckett, Carol Vorderman, Alex Brooker, Sarah Millican and Paul Hollywood

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Miles Jupp and Bob Mortimer and actresses Samantha Morton and Sarah Hadland join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: Three tribes are asked to designate leaders, and they are informed that a twist is coming

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by TV and radio presenter Alice Levine for a packed two-day break in the Estonian capital Tallinn. The pair head to the top of the countrys tallest building, while Alice gives a masterclass in TV presenting, and they walk through a thousand years of Estonian history - including peeping Toms and a cold-war cocktail. They also visit an old KGB outpost, try the sport of kick sledging and sample some new Baltic cuisine, before boarding a submarine for an end-of-trip recap

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: James Mays Man Lab
programme.desc: The presenter engages in a duel over a parking space, tries to navigate a boat using only a compass and a dog, and assembles an orchestra of men who have not played a musical instrument since passing their Grade One exams as children. Elsewhere, John Sergeant tries to beat his personal best time for changing a tyre, and the Man Lab team tries to arrest the decline of the British pub

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders in Lewes, East Sussex, where a vehicle sends bids sky high, John has spotted treasure, and Scotty and Dan play dirty

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Ipswich

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are sent to Bolivia, where they are challenged to travel through the rainforest and journey to the coast of Chile, driving second-hand off-road vehicles bought locally for a maximum of £3,500 each. Along the way, they encounter drug lords and feel the effects of altitude sickness as they negotiate the regions roads, one of which is a notoriously dangerous 40-mile mountain pass dubbed El Camino de la Muerte - the Death Road

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event in London, as amateur drivers put their home-made, gravity-powered vehicles through an obstacle-littered course. The judges for the event at Alexandra Palace were snowboarder Katie Ormerod, racing driver Andrew Jordan, grime artist Blakie and 2015 Red Bull Soapbox Race podium finisher Tony Whitelaw, while contestants included Team Brooklands Special, 24 Seconds of Le Ally Pally and Team Rockin Rolla

programme.title: James Mays Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Singers Sinitta and Johnny Marr and comedians Jo Brand and Ivo Graham join host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure victory

As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian Sam Campbell, actor Will Mellor, singer Kimberley Walsh and newsreader Charlene White join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 17 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Alex Jones, Will Mellor, Naga Munchetty, Romesh Ranganathan, Gabby Logan, Jessica Hynes, Victoria Coren Mitchell, Jack Carroll, Craig Charles, Frankie Boyle, Mo Gilligan, Su Pollard, Jeremy Vine, Bridget Christie, Charlene White, Wilfred Webster, Gina Yashere, Melvyn Hayes, Sam Campbell and Chris McCausland

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: More material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 17 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Charlie Brooker, Johnny Marr, Shazia Mirza, Craig Charles, Kimberley Walsh, Frankie Boyle, Will Mellor, Jeremy Vine, Danny Jones, Charlene White, Amy Gledhill, Jessica Knappett, Sam Campbell and Mo Gilligan

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon introduces a seasonal special of the comedy panel game. TV presenter and poker whizz Victoria Coren Mitchell, BBC Breakfast anchor Naga Munchetty, Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker and veteran actor Melvyn Hayes join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with a few festive fibs or facts about themselves. So, did Victoria really once shock husband David with one of her Christmas presents to him? And did Alex once tip the bin men £500?

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Alison spends more time with Lucy and starts planning to make a big investment - but the Captain and Kitty uncover something suspicious, and need Fannys newfound sleuthing skills to get to the bottom of the mystery before it is too late. Thomas works on his football skills with a little help form Humphreys head, and Julian lends an unseen helping hand to Mikes promo film

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: In the run-up to the festive season, Kitty becomes convinced that Santa has made an early stop at Button House when Mike and Alison discover a man living in a tent on their grounds. The ghosts advice on how to deal with him leaves much to be desired, but eventually Mike and Alison learn that they have more to offer this Christmas than they realised. Jennifer Saunders guest stars

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the sci-fi comedy series. After three million years in suspended animation, Dave Lister awakes to find hes the last surviving member of the human race, with only a mutated cat and a hologram of his least favourite crewmate for company. Craig Charles and Chris Barrie star

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The ship exceeds the speed of light, allowing the crew to see echoes of future events, but while Rimmer gets a pleasant surprise, Lister is shocked to see what appears to be his own violent death. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister yearns for intelligent conversation with people he actually likes, but with only Rimmer for company, he is forced to take desperate action - sitting the chefs exam. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Norman Lovett

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucys disapproving parents, Lees feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are strong-armed into organising a Christmas variety show to raise money for their childrens school. However, things prove to be far from plain sailing, as quality acts are worryingly thin on the ground and an animal impersonator as the only confirmed performer. Who can the duo turn to - surely not Toby and uptight wife Anna? With raw egg-juggling and some knife throwing for good measure, what could possibly go wrong - especially in a live instalment of this award-winning sitcom from 2018? Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden star

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Toby organises a sponsored parachute jump to raise money for a childrens ward in his hospital, so Lee, Lucy, Anna and the grandparents all agree to take part to support him. But once airborne, will everyone pluck up the courage to jump? Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Professor Hannah Fry hosts an extended edition of the current affairs quiz, with comedians Zoe Lyons and Ed Patrick joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Singers Sinitta and Johnny Marr and comedians Jo Brand and Ivo Graham join host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure victory

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: Its the second of the three semi-finals - 30 Ninjas will take their shot at glory, but only seven can qualify for the Grand Final and a shot at conquering Mount Midoriyama

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian Bob Mortimer for a weekend away in in the German city. On arrival in the warehouse district, they check in to a nautical-themed hotel before hitting the Elbphilharmonie - from which they get a 360-degree view of the city below. Richard and Bob join a Beatles tour around the red-light district before sampling hipster cocktails at the Drip Bar, while also finding time to take in cruising, art deco, E numbers, emulsifiers, thickeners, and a beach bar overlooking the shipyards

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jessica Bailey finds it a struggle to fit in amongst the regiment, and an officer makes Chris McLeod jealous after he returns from leave

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Michelle takes care of an elderly patient, while Liam and Ocean decide to cook a meal for Julia

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Two elderly neighbours meet up with a woman who can apparently contact the dead, so Melody visits the ladys house to investigate the rumour. Medical drama, starring Elizabeth Bower

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Kath is devastated to discover Terry has just a few months to live, but refuses to abandon their wedding plans. Elsewhere, a woman is shocked when her husband of 40 years dies after a routine operation. Marty turns up claiming he is a reformed character _ only for the police to come looking for him in connection with local drug dealing. Michele Dotrice guest stars

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jordan finds it increasingly difficult to hide his condition, causing him to launch into an uncharacteristic tirade against a stroppy patient. Tess senses the change in Alice and Curtiss relationship as the couple agree to meet in secret, and Adam remains frustrated that he is restricted to working in cubicles

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A raid culminating in the death of an informer convinces the Drugs Squad that one of Meadows men has been taking bribes from gangsters. Billy Murray and Ray Ashcroft star

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Forced to admit defeat once and for all, Heather faces a life-changing decision. Denise has a new plan to deal with Trina, and Roxy shocks Jack with a drunken admission

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Minty worries that Manda doesnt find him attractive - but is she hiding something more sinister?

programme.title: Miss Fishers Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Aunt Prudence attends a seance, and a ghostly message from beyond the grave leads to the death of a war veteran. Upon investigation, Phryne uncovers a past murder that lay buried in the battlefield for more then a decade. Australian crime drama starring Essie Davis, with Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Pauls god-daughter Amy arrives in Glenbogle intent on causing mischief, but he has precious little time for her as he deals with notorious poacher Tams return to claim his mothers croft - and make trouble for the MacDonald family. Iona moves into the big house while her own is rebuilt, and Zoes unimpressed by Ewan when he covers for Amy. Highland drama, with Lloyd Owen and Kellyanne Farquhar

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Ice maiden Philippa Vale shows up in Jersey just as a large diamond is about to be auctioned - and sure enough, it soon disappears. Liza Goddard guests alongside John Nettles

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor takes up life drawing classes and Margaret is only too happy to see the back of him - until she learns the subject is a nude woman whom he has volunteered to drive home. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: Sir Dennis makes office vamp Lola his secretary - despite years of dedicated service from the less than glamorous Miss Fennel. Comedy, starring Terry Scott, June Whitfield and Reginald Marsh

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour vows that the days of Edie having to carry a dustbin are over, and promises to install a waste disposal unit for her. Meanwhile, a former wartime comrade of Wallys makes an appearance. Michael Aldridge, Thora Hird and Joe Gladwin star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Having witnessed his sister Edie fail several driving tests, Seymour gallantly volunteers to help teach her. However, because he is unable to control a vehicle himself, he needs a qualified motorist to ride along. Michael Aldridge and Thora Hird star

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when a body is found at the stone circle in a polio-stricken village, leading him to conclude that dark forces are involved - and another sacrifice could be imminent. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When a man is found dead inside a locked bank vault, Father Brown must solve the mystery to save an innocent man from paying the ultimate price. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: When a retrospective exhibition of murdered fashion designer Ritchie Levenes work opens, the team is prompted to re-examine the three-year-old crime. The detectives learn about his tempestuous relationships with his new spouse, personal assistant and ex-wife Sarah, who believes his brother Adrian is the killer because he had the most to gain from his death. Meanwhile, Gerry enlists Emily to help update his image, although not everyone is impressed with the results. Crime drama, guest starring Rupert Graves and Hannah Waterman

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jason escapes from the hospital, and the driver who knocked him over is found murdered. The cold case squad uncover a connection between the dead man and Jasons adoptive parents, and turn their attention to the doctor who handled his admission. Detective drama, starring Trevor Eve

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: Two escaped convicts incur the policemans wrath after they kill his beloved dog Wee Jock. Concerned that he may do something he could regret, the men of Lochdubh try to reach him first. Robert Carlyle stars

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor takes up life drawing classes and Margaret is only too happy to see the back of him - until she learns the subject is a nude woman whom he has volunteered to drive home. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: Sir Dennis makes office vamp Lola his secretary - despite years of dedicated service from the less than glamorous Miss Fennel. Comedy, starring Terry Scott, June Whitfield and Reginald Marsh

programme.title: Art Detectives
programme.desc: Mick and Shazia investigate the theft of a rare Chinese vase which has disappeared from the locked vault of a Mayfair auction house

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey gets sick of being taken for granted by Sharon, and suggests they change jobs for a week. Pauline Quirke stars

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: A property war breaks out in Chigwell as man-eating neighbour Dorien and Traceys son Garth compete for the flat above Sharons cafe. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson, Lesley Joseph and Matthew Savage

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Chriss unexpected weekend leave from prison infuriates Tracey, while his model behaviour arouses wife Sharons suspicions. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson, Lesley Joseph and Peter Polycarpou

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe comes to the rescue when a regular customer is hounded by the police, but the sleuthing chef finds himself caught up in a long-running feud between notorious villain Razor Reg Costigan and his arch-rival Striker of the Yard. Offbeat drama, guest starring Nicholas Ball

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe investigates a spate of garden thefts, focusing his inquiries on a horticultural landscaper whose business has blossomed since the robberies began. Unfortunately, his initial stake-out proves a disaster and, to top it all, Margaret hires the chief suspect to redesign the plot behind the restaurant. Drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe has his hands full again, with Fisher breathing down his neck over an operation to seize stolen vehicles, and a fussy food inspector causing a stir at the restaurant. Crime drama, guest starring Phyllis Logan, with Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when a body is found at the stone circle in a polio-stricken village, leading him to conclude that dark forces are involved - and another sacrifice could be imminent. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An armoured security van is discovered at the bottom of a lake, and the team makes a link to a disappearance 17 years previously and an unsolved killing, prompting them to reopen the case. Sandra feels she is making progress after finding the murder weapon, but suffers a setback when a key witness is killed. Detective drama, starring Amanda Redman

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens an investigation into the death of an elderly woman whose decision to leave her estate to her cats sparked a family feud. The subsequent sudden death of the felines, which means the estate reverts to her relatives, prompts a neighbour to insist the detectives get to the bottom of her mysterious demise. Drama, guest starring Eric Sykes, Lindsey Coulson and Victor McGuire

programme.title: Darby and Joan
programme.desc: The search for answers about Jacks past leads him and Joan into the path of two warring brothers, whose feud escalates when one is injured in a suspicious fall

programme.title: Darby and Joan
programme.desc: Jack and Joan help a local nurse who was the victim of a hit-and-run in a small surfing town, only to discover she was involved in a series of suspicious deaths at the hospital

programme.title: The Chelsea Detective
programme.desc: Part one of two. When a popular security guard is stabbed to death, leaving behind a terminally ill wife, it appears as though he died as a result of a drug deal gone wrong

programme.title: The Chelsea Detective
programme.desc: Part two of two. Max and Priyas investigation into the murder of the security guard uncovers the mans unsavoury past filled with violence, racism and hooliganism

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: When four masked men attempt to rob the Brokenwood Savings Bank, Mike and the team must find out which one of them pulled the trigger that killed the bank manager. Detective drama set in a New Zealand town, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Jarod Rawiri and Cristina Ionda

programme.title: Sherwood
programme.desc: As the manhunt closes in on Scott and Andys location, the search for the spycop turns back the clock to 1984 to reveal their identity and the events of that fateful night. At Scotland Yard, Kevin receives a text from Helen arranging to meet. Dawes and Kevin discuss Raggetts suicide and the information from Raggett as to the identity of the officer who stayed behind

programme.title: Sherwood
programme.desc: The Sparrows discuss the arrow found at their door, and which of them could be the intended target, with both Mickey and Rorys names coming up. Ian is more determined than ever to find the spy cop, in a bid to protect those involved, and in the wake of the Sparrow attack he suggests another community meeting. Meanwhile, Kevin returns to the guest house to find Jenny checking in, and the memories quickly come flooding back

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The detective oversteps the mark and finds himself sent back to the Police Training College to learn some professional etiquette and save his pension. Sidekick DS Siobhan Clarke is left to investigate the murder of an art dealer, but it is not long before her boss turns up on the trail of the killer. Ken Stott stars in the crime drama, with Claire Price and Jennifer Black

programme.title: Darby and Joan
programme.desc: Jack and Joan help a local nurse who was the victim of a hit-and-run in a small surfing town, only to discover she was involved in a series of suspicious deaths at the hospital

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The coffin of local poet Declan OGrady falls from the hearse revealing that the corpse inside is not his but a young woman identifiable only by a notable scarlet tattoo. Funeral director Warren Bugle directs Mike, Kristin and Breen to Wadsworth Manor where a mysterious role-playing game was conducted the night before Declans death.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: In a festive episode first broadcast in 1995, Hyacinth resorts to alternative methods of recruitment when she gets no response to the adverts for a pageant she is directing. Suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Del-Boy embarks on a new romance with Raquel, an actress he meets through a computer dating agency, while Rodney takes Nervous Nerys out for a burn in the three-wheeler - but as ever with the Peckham twosome, nothing goes quite according to plan. Christmas special from 1988, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour plans to put the magic back into Christmas - but ends up with Compo stuck on the roof. Festive instalment of the rural comedy from 1986, starring Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Whats Santa Brought for Nora Then?
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1989. Compo has difficulty thinking of what to get Nora for Christmas, so decides to consult Auntie Wainwright for advice. Bill Owen stars

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.sub-title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo Clock
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2005. The south Londoners dreams of joining the country set come one step closer when they attend the Royal Agricultural Ball, where they are introduced to titled gentry Rupert and Jonty, who tempt Boycie to invest in a new polo club - and things get even better when theyre invited to spend Christmas in St Moritz to finalise the deal. However, before they can set off for the airport, a heavy snowfall traps the family and the staff at the farm for the entire festive season - just as two shady-looking characters arrive on the scene. John Challis and Sue Holderness star

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: The shopkeeping comedy returns with a festive instalment. Granville and Gastric find themselves playing marriage counsellors, while Leroy adopts a festive disguise to avoid relationship trouble of a different kind. Meanwhile, Mrs Featherstone struggles to get into the Christmas spirit and Kath attempts to bring the street together as one harmonious choir of carollers to beat Finkle Street once and for all - but does Granville have a trick up his sleeve to help them out? Starring David Jason, Tim Healy, James Baxter and Stephanie Cole

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Father Damien organises a neighbourhood patrol to tackle the rising amount of crime in Finglas, but it quickly becomes clear that Agnes and Winnie are not exactly cut out for catching criminals. Second of two festive specials, starring Brendan OCarroll, Eilish OCarroll and Jennifer Gibney

programme.desc: Lance has failed to detect even so much as a ring-pull in months, leaving Russell to suspect he has been cursed. Seasonal episode of the comedy from 2015, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones and Pearce Quigley

programme.title: Murder on the Blackpool Express
programme.desc: Feature-length comedy about a crime writer (Griff Rhys Jones) who takes a group of his fans on a coach tour of locations from his books. The bus is soon leaving a string of bodies in its wake, and the passengers are faced with the possibility of a murderer in their midst. With Johnny Vegas, Nigel Havers and Una Stubbs

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: As Mike and Alison head off to celebrate Christmas with Mikes parents, the ghosts are touched to discover that Alison has left a gift for each of them in the library, with strict instructions not to open them until the couple return. Touched by her generosity, the spectres are inspired to give her a special Christmas present in return - but with Alison due back in a matter of hours, can they pull off their ambitious plan in time?

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del feels down on his luck after the council rejects his application for a home improvement grant, but his spirits are raised when he hears about a fancy-dress party across town. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield star as the wheeler-dealers in the first part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy. With Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Douglas Hodge and Angela Bruce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del buys a new manual to help him show Raquel more appreciation and give him the confidence to make positive decisions. Unfortunately, as a result of such upbeat thinking, the Trotters cash flow hits an all-time low and an angry punter is left baying for blood. The second part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy, starring David Jason, Tessa Peake-Jones and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Raquel invites her estranged parents around for dinner, and Del-Boy is keen to make an impression - but a mix-up with the gravy boat puts a damper on proceedings. However, things soon take a turn for the better when Dels father-in-law finds an old watch among the Trotters junk, which he claims could net them a pretty packet at auction. But nothing can quite prepare them for the shock they have in store. The final part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The pals look forward to celebrating Christmas, but an unexpected guest disrupts their plans as Richie suffers delusions of grandeur and the whole spirit of the festive season is jeopardised. Anarchic comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall

programme.title: Harry Enfield and Chums
programme.desc: Comedy sketches with the funnyman and partners in mirth Paul Whitehouse and Kathy Burke. Featuring characters Kevin and Perry, Tim Nice-But-Dim and the Self Righteous Brothers

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans travel to Wales to spend Christmas with the Wests, but for Gavin and Stacey, parenthood continues to present them with several challenges, their baby now being 10. Smithy also continues to commit to his fatherly role, making the journey to Barry at weekends and every second Wednesday to see 12-year-old Neil the Baby. Nessa has adopted her own style of mothering, while Pam, Mick and Gwen have become the epitome of doting grandparents. On Christmas Eve, Dawn makes a shocking discovery about Pete that jeopardises their marriage - again - while a visit to the pub becomes an eye-opener in more ways than one. Festive edition from 2019. starring Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The presenter heads to Hastings to meet Mike, who lives in a small two-up two-down cottage with his four rescue dogs. Mike developed hip problems, has become more housebound, and clutter has been building up around him. Nicks team empty the home and give it a much-needed makeover, turning a cramped dark cottage into a welcoming airy space

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: With three kids growing up fast, a familys needs have evolved, and their house is ready for a major change. Jonathan and Drew make the most of a vast main living area

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: After inheriting his grandparents house, Alex wants to transform it into a home he can share with his partner, their beloved dogs, and his extensive guitar collection

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Homes for Veterans - Part One
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team take on their most ambitious project to date and transform a whole street of run-down empty properties in Manchester into homes for veterans. They are joined by the local community, as well as Prince William and Prince Harry, who volunteer their assistance on site. In the first edition of the two-part special, the team builds houses for two former soldiers who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan and are suffering from post traumatic stress disorder. However, with the number of volunteers lacking and the buildings proving to be trickier than expected, the build is becoming the toughest yet

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Homes for Veterans - Part Two
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team continue with their most ambitious project to date, with the assistance of the local community and two royal helpers, Prince William and Prince Harry. The second edition sees them create a home for a veteran, who is a triple amputee after an IED blew up in Afghanistan. They are also aiming to renovate the fronts of the houses on the street and put in new utilities, as well as creating a lasting legacy in the form of a support centre, which will help other veterans find homes and jobs

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Holmfirth, West Yorkshire, to meet Richard Ford, a former policeman who suffered a devastating brain-stem stroke in 2012, and is now confined to an electric wheelchair. With limited movement and speech, he communicates with wife Jude and his three sons via an iPad, but has little privacy when it comes to using the toilet. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team and designer Charlie Luxton turn up to transform the familys home, planning to give Richard the privacy he needs while also assisting his recovery

programme.desc: The teams stand by for casualties as police launch an armed raid on the home of a wanted man. In Bradford a minibus carrying children with special needs is in collision with a stolen car

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The stories of two strong women offering their daughters plenty of support during labour after unplanned pregnancies. Twenty-three-year-old Sam went off the rails as a teenager, running away from home and ending up sleeping rough, before meeting her partner Biaggio, and the couple are grateful to have Sams mum by their side. Claire, 20, always knew she wanted her mother to be there in the delivery room, but deciding whether boyfriend Clint should be present wasnt as easy

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a 49-year-old who has fallen in the street after a night out in Stoke, while in Dudley, paramedics visit a five-month-old who has a temperature

programme.title: Louis Theroux - A Place for Paedophiles
programme.desc: The broadcaster reports from Coalinga State Hospital in California, home to more than 500 sex offenders, many of whom have already served lengthy prison sentences and are deemed unsafe for release. During his visit, Louis finds out about a therapy programme run by psychologists who hope to rehabilitate willing participants - but many inmates refuse to take part, with only 13 having completed the course since it began

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: In the Level Up challenge, the cooks must transform basic tinned food into a bougie brunch that blows the mentors socks off. The Service Challenge is pasta, but with a twist. Theres only one rule - no traditional Italian dishes are permitted Guest judge Nathaniel Smith - AKA @TheGrubworksKitchen - has had huge viral hits with some of his mash-up ideas, and the cook who most impresses in the restaurant kitchen will win a live cook-along with Nathan in front of all his followers. For the nail-biting Knives Out challenge, the bottom two cooks must make churros with salted caramel sauce

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. An 11-year-old boy is abducted by a hooded man in a shopping centre, leading to fears a copycat child killer is on the loose in Sun Hill. Mike Wilson becomes prime suspect when a shrine to convicted murderer Linda Johnson and her deceased partner in crime is found at his home, but as Neil grows closer to his informant in her cell he discovers the case is not nearly as straightforward as it first appeared

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Heaton calls a press conference to tackle the growing media interest in Linda Johnsons involvement in the Clark abduction case, unwittingly attracting the attention of her victims relatives as well. A ransom note mysteriously appears at the station demanding Linda drop off £10,000 in the park to secure Deans release, but the ensuing sting operation threatens to end in tragedy

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: First of an eight-part story. Smithy helps the victim of a knife attack on the Jasmine Allen estate and renews acquaintance with Carly Samuels, a girl he had been helping, who witnessed the incident. It soon emerges that Carly is afraid of her violent boyfriend and keen to start a new life miles away from London. Meanwhile, Beth and Nate encounter a young carer who seeks relief from his responsibilities by setting fire to cars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of eight. Smithy battles in vain to save Carlys life following the shooting and struggles with his feelings back at the station when he is tasked as the family liaison officer. A mobile unit is set up on the estate to help with community problems in light of the gang violence, and Beths decision to bring in Harry the dog proves a winner with Nate when he realises how popular he is with the girls. Cleveland Campbell guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Third of an eight-part story. Diane and Nate investigate an attack on a doctor on the Jasmine Allen estate and discover his colleague Dr Rachel Cartwright (Josette Simon) has been performing illegal operations. Elsewhere, Carly Samuels grieving mother Leanne is upset by a psychics claim that she saw Tito Morientes get into the car used in the drive-by shooting, but nobody is brave enough to give evidence leading to a prosecution

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Alyshea and Maculay worry about the welfare of their premature baby, who was born with lung problems and susceptible to infection and has been carefully monitored at Liverpool Womens Hospital. Samantha and Paul didnt have a chance to enjoy the birth of their first baby due to a complication during delivery, but their nerves are not helped by ending up in the same room on almost the same date. Meanwhile, Kevin and Emma are looking forward to becoming parents, after being forced to postpone their wedding and exotic travels plans

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Rhiannon, who has cystic fibrosis, prepares to risk her life to have a third child, while an unexpected turn of events during labour means Kirsty and her partner, retired soldier Ian, must alter their birth plan. Plus, single mum SammiJo relies on her mum to help her bond with her second baby in a way she couldnt when her first child was born

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Following crews from West Midlands Ambulance Service during the festive period. Laura and Anna are called to a man who has fallen off a roof, hitting his head on the way down

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: West Midlands paramedics assess a man police have found acting erratically on a busy dual carriageway and believe has taken the powerful psychoactive Monkey Dust

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Altered States
programme.desc: The documentary-maker explores the changing face of US culture, beginning with a look at a movement in Portland, Oregon, that seeks to broaden how the world views marriage in a time of rising divorce rates, suggesting that monogamy is not essential and that polyamorous or open relationships can be equally fulfilling. However, while Louis meets many who have found happiness with multiple partners, he also discovers tales of heartbreak and jealousy

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: Its fast food week, and with a place in the semi-final at stake, the final five cooks level up instant noodles and attempt to bash out Mexican fast food in just 90 seconds. Guest judge Sarah Newman reveals that the prize is for the winning cook to get their salsa recipe on the menu nationwide in over 50 Tortilla restaurants. The bottom two must battle it out in the most challenging Knives Out elimination and after a dramatic contest against the clock, one cook is sent home narrowly misses out on a place in the semi-final

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton finds out about Cumnocks ambition to become Scotlands first green town, by running its own renewable energy system and making use of digital and smart technologies. Digging below the surface of these ambitious plans for the town, Ian meets the locals to see what they think about it all and also to find out what smaller steps they are taking to move towards a greener world

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton and Major head to Shotts in North Lanarkshire, a town that appears to be a bit unloved and down on its luck. Since the closing of its iron foundry, there has been very little solid employment. However, Ian and Major find plenty of places to go and people to chat to. They visit the prison, an abandoned psychiatric hospital and even do some street dancing

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton and his guide dog Major head to Angus and the town of Arbroath, a fine red sandstone town which nestles around its historic abbey. programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of the Lancashire village Sunderland Point, which is cut off twice a day by the tide and has become a haven for wildlife. He reveals it was once a busy port that was instrumental in the slave trade, and at the forefront of the luxury goods business that transformed 18th-century Britain.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Walberswick, the former medieval port on the Suffolk coast, which is now a favourite retreat for writers, artists and day trippers. For centuries the village lurched from prosperity to poverty and in medieval times a bitter battle for supremacy was fought against the neighbouring port of Dunwich

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Robin Hoods Bay, the fishing village on the North Yorkshire coast, revealing tales of smuggling intrigue and bravery

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Lindisfarne, which lies off the Northumberland coast. From what became known as the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, monks spread Christianity to the rest of northern England and created one of Britains finest treasures - the Lindisfarne Gospels. Viking attacks caused the monks to flee but the village survived and today the community has to share it with thousands of tourists

programme.desc: Fred travels to the Lake District, which was once one of Britains biggest sources of iron ore. He also takes a trip across a lake in a steamboat, examines how the rail industry made use of local metals, and finally enjoys a pint with former steelworkers in a local pub

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred takes his traction engine to Scotland, where it becomes the first vehicle of its kind to cross the Forth Road Bridge under its own steam. He also visits the Falkirk Wheel and one of the regions few surviving traditional ironworks

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejacks journey takes him to the North East, where he visits a pumping station that ran for 100 years before ceasing operation in 1967 and travels across the Middlesbrough Transporter Bridge. He also discovers a company in Bradford which still makes boilers in the old-fashioned way, with rivets instead of welding

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack fulfils a personal ambition by driving his traction engine across the Scammonden Bridge near Huddersfield, West Yorkshire. He also visits a forge in Sheffield and watches crucible steel being made by the experts at Abbeydale Industrial Hamlet

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack investigates traditional craftsmanship in Yorkshire and Derbyshire, including glass-cutting, making rivets using the traditional hot forge method, and ornate carving. programme.desc: Guy Martin visits Llandudno in north Wales to try to return the seaside resort to its former Victorian glory. Over the course of the winter, Guy gets stuck into restoration work on the towns pier, rebuilds an original helter skelter and services the towns funicular tramway. He learns how the appetite for sea-bathing began when word spread that it was good for the glands and finds out how engineering developments in factories also led to a revolution in musical instruments

programme.title: The Loch
programme.desc: The police hold a press conference to appeal for information about Jonjo, and Smilie hopes to take the opportunity to reassure the public that they have nothing to fear and prevent news of the human heart found by the lake from spreading further. However, his plans are disrupted by Blake, who reveals everything and shares his theory that the community is being terrorised by a serial killer. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass befriends a travelling musician (guest star Gary Barlow) who spreads a little disharmony in Aidensfield, while Jackies parents drop in unexpectedly, casting a shadow over her relationship with Mike - and all at once domestic bliss becomes a thing of the past in the Bradley household. With Bill Maynard, Jason Durr and Fiona Dolman

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A dispute between a retired teacher and a surly farmer gets out of hand, romance is in the air as PC Bellamy escorts Gina to a club opening night, and Greengrass gets a bombshell - literally. Guest starring Angela Thorne and Duncan Preston

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Shaun Evans steps into the shoes of John Thaw in this 1965-set prequel to Inspector Morse, playing a younger version of the cerebral detective involved in the hunt for a missing schoolgirl. Soon deep in a full-blown murder investigation, Endeavour is sidelined, discredited and at a dead end - so he risks all to begin his own quest for justice. Roger Allam and Charlie Creed-Miles co-star in the mystery

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou mixes business with pleasure as he heads to Spain to meet an entrepreneur friend whos looking to get a £100,000 loan on his luxury 18-metre yacht. A young widow finds it difficult to part with her late husbands vintage car to set up a new life in Croatia, jewellery expert Monika is shocked when shes asked to deal with a golden rat, and the shop staff struggle to put a price on some rare and problematic black coral statues

programme.title: The Mayfair Hotel Megabuild
programme.desc: Documentary following a major construction project at Claridges, revealing the engineering challenges involved in digging out a five-storey basement, adding four new floors to the top of the hotel and creating Londons most expensive penthouse. In the first edition, Donegal miners work 24 hours a day to tunnel under the hotel by hand, while hotel manager Eugene tries hard to ensure loyal guests like David Walliams, Christian Louboutin and Damien Hirst remain undisturbed by the work going on above and below them

programme.title: Den of Thieves
programme.desc: An elite unit of the Los Angeles county sheriffs department investigates a series of perfectly executed heists, and uncovers a criminal gang composed of military veterans, whose strategic and combat experience make them an elusive foe. The investigators set out to bring them to justice before they can carry out their biggest robbery yet - stealing $120million from the Federal Reserve Bank. Director Christian Gudegasts crime drama, starring Gerard Butler and Jordan Bridges
